name: Beginning Russian I
info: Listening, speaking, reading, writing.

subject: RUSS
name: Beginning Russian II
info: Listening, speaking, reading, writing.prereq: 1101 or equiv

subject: RUSS
name: Intro Russ Lit
info: Introduction to the study of literature illustrated by materials drawn from Russian literature of the 19th century.

subject: RUSS
name: Freshman Seminar
info: Topics specified in Class Schedule.

subject: RUSS
name: Intermediate Russian I
info: Conversation, composition, grammar review, translation, readings in literature.prereq: 1102 or instr consent

subject: RUSS
name: Intermediate Russian II
info: Expansion of experience in speaking, reading, and understanding Russian. Reading contemporary texts.prereq: 3001 or instr consent

subject: RUSS
name: Advanced Russian I
info: Advanced grammar, conversation, composition, reading.prereq: 3002 or 4104 or instr consent

subject: RUSS
name: Advanced Russian II
info: Advanced grammar, conversation, composition, reading.prereq: 3101 or 4111 or instr consent

subject: RUSS
name: Intro Lit Analysis
info: Reading and analysis of poetry and prose selections to understand rudiments of studying Russian literature. Readings are in Russian.

subject: RUSS
name: Russian Poetry and Prose
info: Appreciation of literary values through stylistic analysis and literary interpretation; analysis of humanistic elements. Readings in Russian.prereq: Russ 3102 or concurrent enrollment in Russ 3102 or permission

subject: RUSS
name: Modern Russ Lit: Tr
info: Literary, cultural, and political significance of modern Russian literary works.

subject: RUSS
name: Russian Major Proj.
info: Directed research and writing in student's chosen field.prereq: Advanced Russian major

subject: RUSS
name: Honor Russ Mjr Proj
info: Directed research and writing in student's chosen field.

subject: RUSS
name: Tolstoy in Translat
info: Novels, stories, and philosophical writings of Leo Tolstoy.

subject: RUSS
name: Anton Chekhov in Translation
fullname: Stories and Plays of Anton Chekhov in Translation
info: Study of literary devices and themes in selected stories and major plays using the intrinsic approach.

subject: RUSS
name: 19th C. Russ Novel
info: The Russian realistic novel from origin to decline. Social, political, and intellectual circumstances that led to its emergence as the dominant genre of the "age of realism" in Russia.

subject: RUSS
name: Dostoevsky in Translation
info: Novels, stories, and miscellaneous writings of Fyodor Dostoevsky.

subject: RUSS
name: MidAges:Dostoevsky
fullname: Literature: Middle Ages to Dostoevsky in Translation
info: Russian literature from about 1000 A.D. to mid-19th century; emphasizing writers of the first half of the 19th century.

subject: RUSS
name: Lit: Tolstoy to the Present
fullname: Literature: Tolstoy to the Present in Translation
info: Survey of Russian literature from mid-19th century to the present:  realism, modernism, feminism and other trends.

subject: RUSS
name: Russ Art & Culture
info: Major trends in Russian visual arts in context of social, political, and ideological questions.

subject: RUSS
name: Translat. Fiction
fullname: Methods of Translating Fiction From Russian to English
info: Learning to appreciate various literary styles through experience of translation.

subject: RUSS
name: Russia At The Movies
fullname: Russia At The Movies: A Survey Of The History Of Russian Cinema
info: This course is designed to provide a chronological overview of major developments, trends, experiments, searches, traditions, and conventions of Russian cinematic art examined in the context of the historical and cultural background of the 20th and early 21st centuries. The history of cinema is intrinsically connected to political, historical, cultural and social developments.For each epoch of development we will first outline the historical and cultural context before investigating the major films and themes of the period. We will elaborate on those films that have made an important contribution to cinematic or cultural history, both in Russia and the world. RUSS 3604/5604 meets the Liberal Education core requirement in Arts and Humanities. Through a close study of film we learn about how this art medium reflects and expresses human experience and engages us through the exploration of the formal and aesthetic dimensions of film, as well as the study of cultural, social, and historical background in which it is deeply steeped.

subject: RUSS
name: Internship for Academic Credit
info: An applied learning experience in an agreed-upon, short-term, supervised workplace activity, with defined goals, which may be related to a student's major field or area of interest. The work can be full or part time, paid or unpaid, primarily in off-campus environments. Internships integrate classroom knowledge and theory with practical application and skill development in professional or community settings. The skills and knowledge learned should be transferable to other employment settings and not simply to advance the operations of the employer. Typically the student's work is supervised and evaluated by a site coordinator or instructor.

subject: RUSS
name: Topics: Russian Lang/Lit/Cultr
fullname: Topics in Russian Language, Literature, and Culture
info: Variable topics in Russian language, literature, and culture. Consult department for details.prereq: 1102 for language topics

subject: RUSS
name: Directed Studies
info: Guided individual study.Prereq instr consent, dept consent, college consent.
